metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 13 axioms covering Peano arithmetic, rational numbers, measures, and half-orders of magnitude
metadata.notation: First-order logic with Peano axiomatization and rational number theory

axioms.title: Zero is a nonnegative integer
axioms.fol: (nonNegInteger 0)
axioms.english: Zero is a nonnegative integer

axioms.title: Every nonnegative integer has a successor
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n) (exists (n1) (and (nonNegInteger n1)(successor n1 n)))))
axioms.english: Every nonnegative integer has a successor which is also a nonnegative integer

axioms.title: Successor argument constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n) (if (successor n1 n) (and (nonNegInteger n1)(nonNegInteger n))))
axioms.english: The arguments of successor are nonnegative integers

axioms.title: Definition of first ten integers
axioms.fol: (and (successor 1 0)(successor 2 1)(successor 3 2) (successor 4 3)(successor 5 4)(successor 6 5) (successor 7 6)(successor 8 7)(successor 9 8) (successor 10 9))
axioms.english: Definition of integers 1 through 10 using successor relation

axioms.title: Definition of positive integer
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (iff (posInteger n)(and (nonNegInteger n)(nequal n 0))))
axioms.english: A positive integer is any nonnegative integer except zero

axioms.title: Zero has no predecessor
axioms.fol: (not (exists (n) (and (nonNegInteger n)(successor 0 n))))
axioms.english: No nonnegative integer has zero as its successor

axioms.title: Successors are unique
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2) (if (and (successor n1 n)(successor n2 n)) (equal n1 n2)))
axioms.english: Successors are unique - each number has exactly one successor

axioms.title: Addition base case
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n)(sum n n 0)))
axioms.english: The sum of a number n and zero is n

axioms.title: Addition recursive step
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2 n3 n4) (if (and (successor n3 n2)(sum n4 n1 n2)) (iff (sum n n1 n3)(successor n n4))))
axioms.english: Recursive definition of addition: n1 + S(n2) = S(n1 + n2)

axioms.title: Nonnegative integers closed under addition
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2 n3) (if (and (nonNegInteger n2)(nonNegInteger n3)(sum n1 n2 n3)) (nonNegInteger n1)))
axioms.english: The nonnegative integers are closed under addition

axioms.title: Addition is associative
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2 n3 n4 n5) (if (and (sum n4 n2 n3)(sum n5 n1 n2)) (iff (sum n n1 n4)(sum n n5 n3))))
axioms.english: Addition is associative: n1 + (n2 + n3) = (n1 + n2) + n3

axioms.title: Addition is commutative
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2) (iff (sum n n1 n2)(sum n n2 n1)))
axioms.english: Addition is commutative: n1 + n2 = n2 + n1

axioms.title: Multiplication base case
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n)(product 0 n 0)))
axioms.english: The product of a number n and zero is zero

axioms.title: Multiplication recursive step
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2 n3 n4) (if (and (successor n3 n2)(product n4 n1 n2)) (iff (product n n1 n3)(sum n n4 n1))))
axioms.english: Recursive definition of multiplication: n1 * S(n2) = (n1 * n2) + n1

axioms.title: Nonnegative integers closed under multiplication
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2 n3) (if (and (nonNegInteger n2)(nonNegInteger n3) (product n1 n2 n3)) (nonNegInteger n1)))
axioms.english: The nonnegative integers are closed under multiplication

axioms.title: One is multiplicative identity
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n)(product n n 1)))
axioms.english: One is the identity under multiplication

axioms.title: Multiplication is associative
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2 n3 n4 n5) (if (and (product n4 n2 n3)(product n5 n1 n2)) (iff (product n n1 n4)(product n n5 n3))))
axioms.english: Multiplication is associative: n1 * (n2 * n3) = (n1 * n2) * n3

axioms.title: Multiplication is commutative
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2) (iff (product n n1 n2)(product n n2 n1)))
axioms.english: Multiplication is commutative: n1 * n2 = n2 * n1

axioms.title: Distributive law
axioms.fol: (forall (n n1 n2 n3 n4 n5 n6) (if (and (sum n4 n2 n3)(product n5 n1 n2)(product n6 n1 n3)) (iff (product n n1 n4)(sum n n5 n6))))
axioms.english: Distributive law: n1 * (n2 + n3) = n1 * n2 + n1 * n3

axioms.title: Definition of less than for integers
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2) (if (and (nonNegInteger n1)(nonNegInteger n2)) (iff (lt n1 n2) (exists (n3)(and (posInteger n3)(sum n2 n1 n3))))))
axioms.english: n1 is less than n2 if there is some positive integer n3 such that n2 = n1 + n3

axioms.title: Definition of less than or equal
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2)(iff (leq n1 n2)(or (lt n1 n2)(equal n1 n2))))
axioms.english: Less than or equal is either less than or equal

axioms.title: Definition of greater than
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2)(iff (gt n1 n2)(lt n2 n1)))
axioms.english: Greater than is the reverse of less than

axioms.title: Definition of greater than or equal
axioms.fol: (forall (n1 n2)(iff (geq n1 n2)(or (gt n1 n2)(equal n1 n2))))
axioms.english: Greater than or equal is either greater than or equal

axioms.title: Nonnegative integers are numbers
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n)(number n)))
axioms.english: A nonnegative integer is a number

axioms.title: Existence of fractions
axioms.fol: (forall (a b) (if (and (nonNegInteger a)(posInteger b)) (exists (f) (fraction f a b))))
axioms.english: Fractions a/b exist for nonnegative integer numerator and positive integer denominator

axioms.title: Fraction equality
axioms.fol: (forall (f1 f2 a1 a2 b1 b2 c1 c2) (if (and (fraction f1 a1 b1)(fraction f2 a2 b2) (product c1 a1 b2)(product c2 a2 b1)) (iff (equal f1 f2)(equal c1 c2))))
axioms.english: Two fractions are equal under the usual conditions: a1/b1 = a2/b2 iff a1*b2 = a2*b1

axioms.title: Integer embedding in rationals
axioms.fol: (forall (n) (if (nonNegInteger n)(fraction n n 1)))
axioms.english: Nonnegative integers can be embedded in rational numbers: n = n/1

axioms.title: Less than for fractions
axioms.fol: (forall (f1 f2 a1 a2 b1 b2 c1 c2) (if (and (fraction f1 a1 b1)(fraction f2 a2 b2) (product c1 a1 b2)(product c2 a2 b1)) (iff (lt f1 f2)(lt c1 c2))))
axioms.english: Extension of lt relation to rational numbers: a1/b1 < a2/b2 iff a1*b2 < a2*b1

axioms.title: Fraction multiplication
axioms.fol: (forall (f f1 f2 a1 a2 b1 b2 c1 c2) (if (and (fraction f1 a1 b1)(fraction f2 a2 b2) (product c1 a1 a2)(product c2 b1 b2)) (iff (product f f1 f2)(fraction f c1 c2))))
axioms.english: Product of two fractions: (a1/b1) * (a2/b2) = (a1*a2)/(b1*b2)

axioms.title: Fractions are numbers
axioms.fol: (forall (f a b)(if (fraction f a b)(number f)))
axioms.english: A fraction is a number

axioms.title: Fraction component constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (f a b) (if (fraction f a b)(and (number a)(number b)(nequal b 0))))
axioms.english: Product requires a number and a nonzero number for numerator and denominator

axioms.title: Existence of nonnegative numeric scales
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 e x y) (if (and (lt' e x y) (forall (n)(if (member n s1) (and (geq n 0)(number n)))) (member 0 s1)) (exists (s) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(nonNegNumericScale s)))))
axioms.english: If e is lt relation and s1 is a set of nonnegative numbers containing 0, then there is a nonnegative numeric scale

axioms.title: Characterization of nonnegative numeric scales
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (if (nonNegNumericScale s) (exists (s1 e x y) (and (lt' e x y) (forall (n)(if (member n s1) (and (geq n 0)(number n)))) (member 0 s1) (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)))))
axioms.english: A nonnegative numeric scale has the lt relation for its ordering and a set of numbers, including zero, as its components

axioms.title: Definition of measure
axioms.fol: (forall (m s1) (iff (measure m s1) (exists (s2) (and (scale s1)(nonNegNumericScale s2) (functionInto m s1 s2) (monotoneIncreasing m) (forall (x)(if (bottom x s1)(map m x 0)))))))
axioms.english: A measure is a monotone increasing function from a scale into a nonnegative numeric scale, mapping the bottom to zero

axioms.title: Cardinality as measure
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y s1 s m n u) (if (and (forall (z)(if (member z s1)(set z))) (exists (w)(and (member w s1)(null w))) (subset' e x y) (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e) (card' m n u)) (measure m s)))
axioms.english: Cardinality is a measure on the scale of sets ordered by subset relation

axioms.title: Definition of proportion
axioms.fol: (forall (f x y m s1) (if (and (measure m s1)(inScale x s1)(inScale y s1)) (iff (proportion f x y m) (exists (n1 n2) (and (map m x n1)(map m y n2) (fraction f n1 n2))))))
axioms.english: The proportion of x to y is the fraction f = m(x)/m(y) where m is a measure

axioms.title: Proportion argument constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (f x y m) (if (proportion f x y m) (exists (s1) (and (measure m s1)(inScale x s1)(inScale y s1)))))
axioms.english: The constraints on the arguments of proportion ensure they're on a scale with the given measure

axioms.title: Definition of identity function
axioms.fol: (forall (f s) (iff (identityFunction f s) (and (function f s s) (forall (x)(if (member x s)(map f x x))))))
axioms.english: The identity function maps every element of s into itself

axioms.title: Identity function as measure
axioms.fol: (forall (f s) (if (and (nonNegNumericScale s)(identityFunction f s)) (measure f s)))
axioms.english: The identity function on a nonnegative numeric scale is a measure

axioms.title: Measure as at relation
axioms.fol: (forall (m s1 s2 x y) (if (and (measure m s1)(function m s1 s2)(disjoint s1 s2) (map m x y)) (at x y s2)))
axioms.english: When scales are disjoint, if an entity is mapped to a point by a measure, it is at that point

axioms.title: Same half-order of magnitude (case 1)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s1 m) (if (and (leqs x y s1)(measure m s1)) (iff (sameHOM x y s1 m) (exists (f f2) (and (proportion f y x m)(product f2 f f) (leq f2 10))))))
axioms.english: Two entities are the same half-order of magnitude if the proportion squared is ≤ 10 (when x ≤ y)

axioms.title: Same half-order of magnitude (case 2)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s1 m) (if (and (gts x y s1)(measure m s1)) (iff (sameHOM x y s1 m)(sameHOM y x s1 m))))
axioms.english: Same half-order of magnitude is symmetric (when x > y, use the other direction)

axioms.title: Same half-order of magnitude constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s1 m) (if (sameHOM x y s1 m) (and (inScale x s1)(inScale y s1)(measure m s1))))
axioms.english: The constraints on the arguments of sameHOM ensure they're on a scale with the given measure

conversion_notes.peano_arithmetic: Complete Peano axiomatization of nonnegative integers with successor function
conversion_notes.rational_numbers: Extension to rational numbers (fractions) with proper equality and ordering
conversion_notes.numeric_scales: Integration with scale theory from Chapter 12 for nonnegative numeric scales
conversion_notes.measures_and_proportions: Sophisticated treatment of measurement functions and proportional relationships
conversion_notes.half_orders_of_magnitude: Novel qualitative reasoning framework for approximate quantitative judgments
conversion_notes.procedural_attachment: Note that practical systems would use efficient arithmetic rather than theorem proving
conversion_notes.constants_introduced: Only constants in the book: integers 0-10

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 13 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.mathematical_foundation: Provides complete arithmetic foundation for quantitative reasoning in psychology
